content.description: Face to wandering cracks, grainy and tricky. Both bolts replaced 12/04.
content.location: Face to the right of the approach chimney for the upper routes, then wandering cracks.

content.description: The face on the left side of the upper face, with steep scoops and horizontal cracks to fun thin face. The face holds end about 2/3 of the way up the face, where there's a 2-bolt anchor. Originally rated 5.10a but the reach/lunge after the first bolt seems to cause a lot of problems!
content.protection: 4 bolts, pro to 2" (to 3" for p1 anchor), 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: Left side of the upper face, approach either by the 5.7 chimney or Beach Party.

content.description: Probably the best crack at the Buttermilk crags, fingers, stemming, and flared hands. Approach pitch is grainy 5.7 chimney, or you can use Beach Party as an alternate approach pitch.
content.location: The crack on the right side of the upper face.

content.description: Excellent face climbing with some thin crack. Runout on small holds above last bolt, but the fall is clean and the crux is just past the bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts, RPs to 1" for crux pitch, pro to 3" for p1 anchor. 2-bolt anchor well over the top. First pro bolt and one anchor bolt replaced 12/04, the other bolts are good 3/8".
content.location: The face just left of My Beach, My Wave, which starts up the finger crack only 6' left. Shares the 5.7 approach pitch, or you can approach via Beach Party.

content.description: Fun face and tricky stem/lieback crux, but grainy.
content.location: The bolted face left of the approach chimney, starting with a grainy mantle. The climb is nearly a sport climb but requires trad gear for the anchor.
